title: Toward once-monthly insulin therapy via synergy in two pharmacokinetic protractors: Fc-conjugation and fatty acid acylation
content:
RSC Chem. Biol., 2024, 5,763-775
DOI: 10.1039/D4CB00078A, Paper
Open Access
  This article is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported Licence.
Alexander N. Zaykov, Vasily M. Gelfanov, Tina M. Tagmose, Damien Demozay, Valentina Manfè, Rebecca Rohlfs, Marita Rivir, Diego Perez-Tilve, Brian Finan, Richard D. DiMarchi
Pharmacokinetic properties of a peptide hormone are extended via the combination of fatty acid acylation and Fc-conjugation, as shown with double protracted insulin analogs. This approach may be expanded to other peptide- and protein-based therapies.
